metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5461 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the vararg functions in ldo.c in Lua 5.1 through 5.2.x before 5.2.3 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a small number of arguments to a function with a large number of fixed arguments.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblua5.1-0 - 5.1.5-5ubuntu1
lua5.1 - 5.1.5-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

liblua50 - 5.0.3-7
liblualib50 - 5.0.3-7
lua50 - 5.0.3-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lua5.1 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.5-5ubuntu1').
lua50 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.3-7').
